subject: Data
title: W.E.B. Du Bois: Data as Civil Rights Weapon
description: A fast breakdown of W.E.B. Du Bois: Data as Civil Rights Weapon for builders.

hook.text: At the 1900 Paris World's Fair, a Black sociologist displayed hand-drawn charts that stunned visitors.

buildup.text: W.E.B. Du Bois created 63 data visualizations showing the economic progress of Black Americans.

discovery.text: His charts used bold colors and innovative designs to make racial inequality visible and undeniable.

twist.text: Du Bois deliberately chose artistic, eye-catching designs because he knew data alone wasn't enough.

climax.text: His charts are now recognized as pioneering works of both data visualization and social activism.

punchline.text: He turned data into a weapon for equality.

quiz.question: What was the purpose of Du Bois's data visualizations at the 1900 World's Fair?
options: To show economic progress of Black Americans
